title: Bi-Weekly Gaming Discussion Thread
selftext:
What are you playing, r/India? Let us use this thread to discuss any games you're playing, have played or are going to play. (Mobile and board games included!)

What game are you looking forward to? Are you a developer? Show us your wares!

Please don't just list the names of games, make sure to write a word or two about them as well.

Check out r/IndianGaming! They are an active community and also host a few co-op sessions.

**Gaming Thread is posted every two weeks on Tuesday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Gaming+Discussion+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/xagdqefyv8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=f975f1c3093a3d9598a1da39854b03d1250bd55d
comments: I had pre-ordered God Of War Ragnarok and finished it recently. Worth every penny! Everything was fantastic.
Looking to buy my first console? What is a good price for a used PS4?
You can buy one for 13-15k depending on the condition. Make sure you get the slim version as the fat ps4 is pretty old by today’s standards
Been playing zelda botw and mario kart 8 online recently..despite having very little communication , mk8 online is so fun
I recently got MK8, there is no such mode as competitive right? Just join races and try to win?
yup, as far as i know its just either a standard race or a battle mode. you can turn it competitive by spamming "im using tilt controls " :p

>you can turn it competitive by spamming "im using tilt controls " :p

That's so evil lol

Just finished A Plague Tale: Requiem

What a game. It shows the game is created with love. But the 1st part was still better.
Deleted after they introduced Clan War 2.
In the middle of it. Loving it. Its quite long
